job_description:
As a technology innovator in the global gaming, lottery, and interactive industries, Scientific Games is an exciting place to work. We drive innovation, champion ground-breaking ideas, and bring meaning to our work every day.

Scientific Games is looking for a Senior System Administrator to join its Site Operations Team, responsible for tier 2 lottery system and Interactive service operations support for lottery jurisdictions. This includes support for various operating systems, relational database management systems, and web hosting in a virtual environment as well as proprietary software support. The Site Team Engineers work closely with other Scientific Games departments to ensure the timely support of all products. They must be able to demonstrate a high degree of initiative and provide timely completion of assigned tasks, respecting the organizational level and service level agreements in place. A Site Team Engineer must be able to demonstrate a solid understanding of troubleshooting techniques and logical thought processes.

Responsibilities

Provide tier 2 technical support during a 24x7 on call rotation to Scientific Games Lottery and Interactive based production systems
Provide tier 2 support to development and QA systems
New system implementation including builds, system performance analysis, and vetting
Install and configure operating systems, and manage their lifecycles (Windows, Linux - Ubuntu and RedHat)
Schedule and Install Windows and Linux operating system patches.
Manage SSL certificates
Monitor server performance to identify problems and make adjustments to improve performance
Install and configure system security tools such as anti-virus and file integrity tools
Troubleshooting of production problems including defining root causes and solutions
Liaison between Lottery customer operations and SG Development groups
Technical Documentation
Communicate technical incident details to business customers
Remotely build, configure, and manage Windows Server and Linux enterprise systems
Create, maintain, and update troubleshooting procedures, knowledge base articles, and technical bulletins.
Prioritize through evaluating impact, severity, and resources available
Provides onsite support during system implementations and system overhauls

Qualifications

Education: Associate degree in a related field of study required; Bachelor's Degree preferred
Min 8 years' experience in operations support role, supporting enterprise-scale transactional platforms with strong emphasis on systems hardware and network communications.
Experience in the lottery and gaming industry would be considered a strong asset.
Windows Server (2008+) administrative experience
Linux (Ubuntu 12+ or RHEL 6+) administrative experience
Familiarity with SQL Server, MySQL and/or Oracle
Ability to create scripts in Python, Bash, Linux, PowerShell or other language
Thorough understanding of server hardware
Knowledge and experience in working with infrastructure virtualization (VMWare) and Storage Area Networks (SAN)
Understanding of network communications fundamentals
Excellent system and network troubleshooting skills
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Excellent communication skills - verbal and written
Demonstrated ability to work and prioritize with minimal direct supervision
Comfortable working within a disbursed team over a wide geographic area
Hands-on experience implementing Windows Server based server architectures
Hands-on experience implementing Linux Server based server architectures
Experience in the creation of detailed product installation requirements
